review.body: Lolz?

Wow!!! Another grand slam with Alex Cross. A novel that will keep you up all night.

A thriller that only Patterson can develop in his distinctive fashion. Enjoyed every page; can't wait for the next thriller.

موسيقا... هنا يتسمع أعذب الألحان. ....
الكلمات تغني وتبكي وترقص مذبوحة...
Not sure that whole thing at the bottom was necessary, but the artwork is very pretty and the story is very nice.

book.title: Into the Magic Shop: A Neurosurgeon's Quest to Discover the Mysteries of the Brain and the Secrets of the Heart

review.body: One of those rare books where, as I'm reading it, I keep thinking of more and more and more people I want to give it to!

A MINI SOAP IN A BOOK!

What you'll find in these captivating stories; a cast of remarkable impressive and engaging characters, family issues, fabulous banter, powerful vivid scene descriptions, spectacular story-lines, pent-up rage, emotions sky-rocket, betrayal lingers in the air, heart-wrenching...

Great read

What a great read! I couldn't put it down and the ending was more than I expected. I will recommend to all my friends.

Good read, nice storyline

This was a sweet, passionate love story with characters that really came to life. I don't usually read fiction, let alone romance novels, but I must say that this book has opened the door to the genre for me. The book was a gift that I'm happy to have received.

book.title: Led Astray by a Rake (The Husband Hunters Club, #1)

review.body: This was okay. I liked that the heroine was so determined.

Three World Connect

The past, the future, and a fantasy world. Pears combines science fiction and fantasy to ruminate on the meaning of time and the stories we tell and how they affect our lives, while weaving a story that never flags.
Nice version of the Princess and the Pea. It keeps the humor, while being more realistic. Violet and Richard are a good couple.

Great job

Loved this book, one of the best in the dark series. Ready for the next book and poor Gary, his story has to be awesome!

book.title: Believe Me, Goldilocks Rocks!: The Story of the Three Bears as Told by Baby Bear

review.body: We love fractured fairy tales!
Magical. Didn't want it to end.

This was actually a really good book. I think a lot of invisible kids will see themselves in this book, and maybe kids can use it to see how it only takes one person to make a kid feel seen and not left out.

book.title: An Alchemy of Mind: The Marvel and Mystery of the Brain

review.body: Loved this book. Ackerman's writing is so rich and beautiful--but also packed with information and provocative food for thought.

book.title: The Shop on Blossom Street (Blossom Street, #1 )

review.body: I enjoyed the relationships built in this book.

book.title: La guerra del Paraná: Vuelta de Obligado y El Quebracho

review.body: Colección La Historia en Historietas, tomo dedicado a Vuelta de Obligado y El Quebracho.

3.5 Stars

It is a well written book worth reading, albeit being too whiny and unnecessarily wordy at times. With flourishing language and biting sarcasm, the author does a commendable job demonstrating the ambiguity of morality and the utter irony of the human condition; I was specially touched by...

book.title: Orphan of Destiny (The Youngest Templar, #3)
book.publisher: Putnam Juvenile/G.P. Putnam's Sons/Penguin Young Readers Group

review.body:
The story begins in 1191, Calais, France and moves through the English country side on the way to Scotland.
In the final leg of Tristan's quest, the legend of Robin Hood is born. There is also the expected final confrontation between Tristan and Sir Hugh.
A very good conclusion to a well written hi...
